intro: Pholidota kouytcheensis, commonly known as the Kouytchean pholidota, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair. Pholidota kouytcheensis is adapted to arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
